text:

Over the centuries, I have devoted countless hours to deciphering and translating the ancient scripts and dialects of the various peoples of Middle-earth. My goal is to gain a deeper understanding of the cultures and histories of these peoples by studying their languages. Currently, I am working on a monograph that explores the linguistic roots of the Elvish languages. Through extensive research and analysis, I hope to shed light on the connections between the different dialects of Elvish and their origins. This project has been particularly challenging, as Elvish is a complex and nuanced language, but I am determined to see it through to completion.

text:
The History of the War of the Ring

arXiv Preprint | Code
I am creating a comprehensive and detailed history of the conflict that goes beyond the surface-level events. By gathering information from a variety of sources, including my own memories, written accounts, and oral histories, I hope to shed new light on this important period in Middle-earth’s history and provide valuable insights into the motivations and actions of the various players involved.

title: Photography
text:
As a wizard and scholar of Middle-earth, I have been studying the magic of the natural world for centuries. Through my self-portraits, I aim to capture the essence of my own being and reflect on my own journey through time. Each photograph is a reflection of my own experiences and emotions. Through my photography, I hope to offer a glimpse into my life as a scholar and adventurer, and inspire others to reflect on their own journeys through the world.

title: Welcome to my personal website!
text:
English
I am currently a Postdoctoral Fellow in the Doctoral Program in Economic Studies at the Universidad de Guadalajara. I hold a Ph.D. in Economic Studies and an MSc in Economics from the same institution.
My research interests are at the intersection of international, macro, and development economics, with a particular focus on economic and financial integration between countries with different levels of development. Recently, I have initiated two research projects using subnational data from Mexico: one on the development of short- and long-term forecasts, and another studying the heterogeneous impacts of monetary policy at the state level.
In addition to my research, I work as a consultant and trainer in project and data management for social science research projects. I assist research teams in establishing workflows for data management, project collaboration, and documentation to ensure that their work is replicable and reproducible. I also teach how to use R, Python, and GitHub.
I previously served as a Performance Audit Analyst at the Auditoría Superior del Estado de Jalisco (ASEJ). I also worked as a Data Scientist and Public Finance Analyst at the Instituto para el Desarrollo Técnico de las Haciendas Públicas de México (INDETEC).
I am a recognized Candidate to Researcher in the Mexican System of Researchers (2024–2027) and a recipient of the Emerging Scholars from Emerging Markets Fellowship (2022–2023).
Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or would like to discuss potential projects.

title: Welcome to my personal website!
text:
Español
Actualmente soy Investigador Postdoctoral en el Programa de Doctorado en Estudios Económicos de la Universidad de Guadalajara. Previamente, completé mi doctorado en Estudios Económicos, así como mi maestría y licenciatura en Economía en la misma institución.
Mis intereses de investigación se encuentran en la intersección de la economía internacional, macroeconomía y economía del desarrollo, con un enfoque particular en la integración económica y financiera entre países con diferentes niveles de desarrollo. Recientemente, he iniciado dos proyectos de investigación utilizando datos subnacionales de México: uno sobre el desarrollo de pronósticos macroeconómicos de corto y largo plazo, y otro que estudia los impactos heterogéneos de la política monetaria a nivel estatal.
Además de mi investigación, trabajo como consultor e instructor en gestión de proyectos y datos para científicos sociales. Asisto a equipos de investigación en el establecimiento de flujos de trabajo para la gestión de datos, colaboración en proyectos y documentación, asegurando que su trabajo sea replicable y reproducible. También enseño cómo usar R, Python y GitHub.
Previamente me desempeñé como Analista de Auditoría al Desempeño en la Auditoría Superior del Estado de Jalisco (ASEJ). También trabajé como Científico de Datos y Analista de Finanzas Públicas en el Instituto para el Desarrollo Técnico de las Haciendas Públicas de México (INDETEC).
Soy reconocido como Candidato a Investigador en el Sistema Nacional de Investigadores (2024–2027) y fui becario del programa Emerging Scholars from Emerging Markets Fellowship (2022–2023).
Por favor, no dudes en contactarme si tienes alguna pregunta o si te gustaría discutir proyectos potenciales.
